agent_profile_summary: Ethan Schmehl, a 38-year-old case manager in Chicago, grew up in a working-class family in the East North Central region, where his parents instilled in him the values of education and service. After earning a bachelor’s degree in social work, he chose to forgo a lucrative corporate job in finance, opting instead to work with low-income families through a nonprofit, a decision that defined his career and life purpose. Married with two young children, he balances his full-time role at HopeBridge with family life, often volunteering at a local food pantry and prioritizing community engagement. Despite financial strains and health challenges, including chronic back pain, Ethan remains committed to his work and his neighborhood, navigating the tension between personal well-being and his drive to support others. His life is shaped by a deep sense of responsibility, rooted in the sacrifices of his parents and the belief that meaningful impact comes from showing up, even when it’s hard.
